intro: Saracha sessilis, commonly known as the sessile saracha, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or alpine regions. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
